Choose the the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.

Ceremoniously?

Choose the the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.



Understandable?

Choose the the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.



Understandable?
explanation:
In some words with suffixes, the stress stays on the same syllable as in the root. Example: ‘DANger and: ‘DANgerous

The following are example of Suffixes which don’t usually change the stress pattern in the root word, they include -able, -age, -al, -er, -ful, -less, -ness, -ous and -fy. Therefore, the stress pattern for ''understandable'' is on the first syllable (root) thus; UNderstandable

question:
Choose the the appropriate stress pattern from the options. The syllables are written in capital letters.

Management?
explanation:
Every word has one syllable that receives a primary stress—that is, it is vocally emphasized more than any other syllable. when pronouncing ''man-age-ment'', you will notice the 3 syllable word has a risen tone on the second syllable. the voice tone is lower in the first and third than it is in the second syllable. thus we have

MAN-AGE-MENT
